abstract: As Microsoft looks to buy Yahoo to shore up its search business, a recent column in The New York Times suggested that Microsoft might consider acquiring SAP instead — a move that would bolster its business-software unit, which sells under the brand Microsoft Dynamics.
lead_paragraph: As Microsoft looks to buy Yahoo to shore up its search business, a recent column in The New York Times suggested that Microsoft might consider acquiring SAP instead — a move that would bolster its business-software unit, which sells under the brand Microsoft Dynamics.

headline.main: Should Microsoft Be Selling, Not Buying?
